stimulusHtml: Which of the following contexts best explains the construction of transcontinental railroads in the late 1800s?
choicesHtml: Reconstruction policies allowed freedom of movement for formerly enslaved people.
Westward migration created consumer demand for a transportation system connecting the East and the West.
Conflicts between the North and the South drove their economic development in different directions.
Large-scale industrial production brought business consolidation and the needed capital to support railroad construction.
